summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 discussing coordination between a sender and law firms to ensure all victims of Jeffrey Epstein receive an invitation to a DOJ briefing. The sender is confirming victim names and contact information with law firms to provide to the DOJ/FBI, with concerns raised about confidentiality.

events.title: Email exchange about victim briefing
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the provision of victim names and contact information to the DOJ to ensure all victims receive an invitation to a briefing.

events.title: Confirmation of victim information
events.description: The sender confirms they are verifying victim names and contact details with each law firm to ensure every victim receives a DOJ briefing invite, noting additions and changes in victim representation.

keyFacts: The DOJ/FBI was organizing a briefing for Epstein victims in October 2020.
Law firms were being contacted to confirm victim names and contact information to ensure all victims received an invitation.
There were concerns about keeping victim names completely confidential by the FBI/DOJ.
The sender referenced using information from a previous victim briefing sent out the prior year.
The email chain indicates ongoing coordination between legal representatives and the DOJ regarding victim outreach.
